odor-removal.title: Odor removal
odor-removal.shortDesc: Removal of ingrained and persistent odors
odor-removal.content:
Ozonation is the most effective method for removing ingrained odors in premises. Unlike air fresheners and deodorizers, ozone does not mask odors but fully breaks down odor molecules into safe compounds: water and carbon dioxide.

As a gas, ozone penetrates everywhere: crevices, material pores, upholstery, carpets and even ventilation systems. This allows treating all surfaces at once, including areas inaccessible to manual cleaning.

Ozonation effectiveness depends on odor intensity, room volume, temperature and humidity. Lower temperature means more stable ozone and longer activity. At 0–5°C ozone can remain active for days; at 50°C it decays in 20–30 minutes.

After treatment, ozone fully decays to oxygen with no chemical residues. The room is ready for use after 30–60 minutes of ventilation.

intro.text: Unpleasant odors in premises are not just discomfort. Most synthetic and organic odors contain toxic substances: benzene, formaldehyde, ammonia, trichloroethylene. They are carcinogenic and mutagenic, causing headaches, fatigue, blood pressure spikes.
intro.text2: Traditional odor control methods — fresheners, fragrances, sorbents — only mask the problem or slowly absorb molecules from the air. Ozonation works differently: ozone actively oxidizes odorous substances, breaking them down into safe compounds — water and carbon dioxide.

highlight1.title: Principle of action:
highlight1.text: Ozone (O₃) is the strongest oxidizer, 3000 times more effective than chlorine. It attacks odor molecules at the chemical level, irreversibly destroying their structure. After the reaction, the odor disappears forever until a new source appears.

odors.title: What odors ozone eliminates
odors.text: Ozonation is effective against almost any organic and inorganic odors:
items: Tobacco smoke — ingrained in walls, furniture, textiles
Post-renovation odor — paint, glue, stretch ceilings, new furniture
Mustiness and mold — in damp rooms, basements, after flooding
Food odors — spoiled products, fish, spices
Household odors — sweat, stale laundry, household chemicals
Party odor — alcohol, food, tobacco

steps.title: Room preparation
steps.description: Perform standard cleaning, remove visible contamination sources. Remove houseplants, take out pets. Close windows and turn off supply ventilation.

steps.title: Parameter calculation
steps.description: Determine room volume and required ozone concentration. For weak odors: 10-20 mg/m³, for medium: 20-40 mg/m³, for strong: 40-80 mg/m³.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Install ozone generator, leave room, start treatment for calculated time. Use a fan for even ozone distribution.

steps.title: Exposure
steps.description: Keep ozone in room from 30 minutes to several hours after generator shutdown. Ozone continues working until it decays.

steps.title: Ventilation
steps.description: Open windows and doors, turn on exhaust ventilation. Ventilate until characteristic ozone smell disappears (15-60 minutes).

fire-smoke.title: Fire aftermath
fire-smoke.shortDesc: Removal of smoke and soot odor
fire-smoke.content:
Fire smoke odor is among the hardest to remove. Smoke and soot particles penetrate plaster, concrete, wood, textiles and soak into upholstery and carpets. Conventional cleaning cannot remove this odor — it keeps coming back.

Ozonation is the only method that can fully eliminate fire odor without major renovation. Ozone penetrates all materials at the molecular level and oxidizes soot and combustion products, breaking their chemical structure.

Post-fire treatment requires high ozone concentrations (40–80 mg/m³) and long exposure — 24 to 72 hours depending on damage. Multiple cycles with ventilation between are recommended.

Before ozonation, clean visible soot, wipe surfaces and remove badly damaged items. Ozone does not physically remove soot — it only eliminates the odor.

intro.text: Fire smoke odor is among the most persistent and difficult to remove. Combustion products penetrate deep into building materials: plaster, concrete, brick, wood. Tiny soot particles are absorbed into textiles, upholstery, carpets, wallpaper. Traditional cleaning and ventilation don't help — the odor keeps coming back.
intro.text2: Many property owners after a fire are forced to do a full renovation with replacement of finishes. However, ozonation allows solving the problem faster and cheaper — without demolishing walls and replacing furniture.

highlight1.title: Why fire smoke odor is so persistent:
highlight1.text: When organic materials burn, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs), soot, and resins are formed. These substances have microscopic particle sizes (0.1-1 μm) and penetrate deep into the pores of building materials. Regular cleaning only removes the surface layer.

howOzone.title: How ozone eliminates fire smoke odor
howOzone.text: Ozone is a gas that penetrates everywhere smoke and soot particles have reached. It oxidizes organic compounds at the molecular level, breaking chemical bonds in combustion product molecules. As a result, safe compounds are formed — water and carbon dioxide.
items: Penetrates micropores of concrete, plaster, brick
Treats wooden structures from inside
Reaches hidden cavities behind wall cladding
Passes through textiles and furniture upholstery
Cleans ventilation systems and ducts
Treats books, documents, clothing

steps.title: Preliminary cleaning
steps.description: Remove visible soot and smoke residue from all surfaces. Wipe walls, ceilings, floors. Vacuum upholstery and carpets. Remove severely damaged items.

steps.title: Room sealing
steps.description: Close all windows and doors. Seal ventilation openings. Seal gaps. This is necessary to maintain high ozone concentration.

steps.title: First ozonation cycle
steps.description: Install ozone generator, leave the room. Treatment at 40-80 mg/m³ concentration for 8-24 hours. Ozone must completely fill the room volume.

steps.title: Ventilation and assessment
steps.description: Ventilate the room for 2-4 hours until ozone odor completely disappears. Assess the result. If necessary, perform additional wet cleaning.

steps.title: Repeat cycles (if needed)
steps.description: For heavy smoke damage, 2-3 treatment cycles with ventilation breaks are required. Each cycle further reduces odor concentration.

modes.title: Treatment modes depending on damage level

highlight.title: Important:
highlight.text: Ozone does not physically remove soot — it only eliminates the odor. Mechanical cleaning is mandatory before ozonation. Also, ozone does not restore damaged materials — charred surfaces require repair.

whenNotHelp.title: When ozonation won't help
whenNotHelp.text: Ozonation is not a universal solution. There are cases when additional treatment or repair is required:
items: Charred surfaces — require mechanical cleaning or replacement
Water-soaked materials after firefighting — drying first
Melted plastic — odor source not eliminated by ozone
Deeply sooted drywall — may require replacement
Ventilation systems with accumulated soot — require mechanical cleaning

highlight.title: Recommendation:
highlight.text: For maximum effect, combine ozonation with professional cleaning. First — mechanical removal of soot, then — ozonation to eliminate ingrained odor.

pet-odors.title: Pet odors
pet-odors.shortDesc: Removal of cat and dog urine odor
pet-odors.content:
Pet odors, especially cat urine, are among the most persistent and difficult to remove. Uric acid crystallizes in fabric fibers and reactivates with humidity, releasing a sharp ammonia smell. Conventional products only mask the problem temporarily.

Ozone breaks down uric acid crystals at the molecular level, fully removing the odor source. The gas penetrates upholstery, carpets, mattresses and baseboards — everywhere pets may have left marks.

For effective treatment, clean visible stains with an enzymatic cleaner first, then dry surfaces. Ozonation is run at 20–40 mg/m³ for 4–8 hours. Severe cases may need 2–3 cycles.

Important: ozonation is done with no people or pets present. After treatment, ventilate for 1–2 hours until the typical ozone smell is gone.
benefits: Removal of marks in hard-to-reach spots

intro.text: Pet odors, especially cat urine, are one of the most common reasons for contacting cleaning companies. This odor is almost impossible to remove with conventional means. Air fresheners only mask the problem, and the odor returns again and again, especially in humid weather.
intro.text2: The reason for the persistence of the odor is uric acid. Unlike other components of urine (urea and urochrome), it does not dissolve in water and crystallizes in fabric fibers. When humidity increases, the crystals activate and again release a sharp ammonia smell.

highlight1.title: Why conventional products don't work:
highlight1.text: Most cleaning products remove water-soluble components of urine, creating an illusion of cleanliness. But uric acid crystals remain in fabric fibers and activate when humidity increases. Ozone chemically breaks down these crystals, making the result permanent.

howItWorks.title: How ozone eliminates pet odors
howItWorks.text: Ozone is a powerful oxidizer that breaks down the molecular structure of uric acid. Being a gas, it penetrates everywhere urine could have reached: upholstery, carpets, mattresses, baseboards, floor cracks.
items: Oxidizes uric acid crystals into safe compounds
Penetrates porous materials to full depth
Treats hard-to-reach areas (under furniture, behind baseboards)
Destroys bacteria causing additional odor
Neutralizes pheromones animals use to mark territory
Leaves no chemical residues after treatment

process.title: Ozonation process for pet odor removal

steps.title: Source localization
steps.description: Identify all places where pets left marks. Use a UV flashlight — urine glows in ultraviolet light. Mark all detected spots.

steps.title: Preliminary cleaning
steps.description: Treat visible stains with an enzymatic cleaner. It breaks down organic components of urine. Let dry completely before ozonation.

steps.title: Room preparation
steps.description: Remove pets and houseplants. Close windows, doors, ventilation. Raise curtains and drapes for better ozone access.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Place the ozone generator in the center of the room. Run for 4-8 hours at 20-60 mg/m³ concentration. Use a fan for even distribution.

steps.title: Assessment and retreatment
steps.description: Ventilate the room for 1-2 hours. Assess the result. For severe contamination, repeat treatment after 24 hours. Usually 2-3 cycles are needed.

features.title: Apartment with multiple cats
features.description: Multiple marks around the perimeter. Requires 3-4 ozonation cycles with high concentration

features.title: Wooden floor
features.description: Urine soaks into wood. Ozonation is the only way to treat wood without replacement

features.title: Preparation for sale/rental
features.description: Buyers are sensitive to odors. Ozonation is mandatory for apartments with pets

features.title: Upholstered furniture
features.description: Sofas and armchairs are favorite marking spots. Can be treated locally by covering with film

localTreatment.title: Local furniture treatment
localTreatment.text: If the odor is localized in a specific piece of furniture, chamber ozonation can be performed:
items: Cover the item with plastic film, creating a "chamber"
Press film edges to the floor for sealing
Run hose from ozone generator under the film
Run ozone generator for 2-4 hours
This creates high ozone concentration directly in the item
After treatment — ventilate for 30-60 minutes

highlight.title: Tip:
highlight.text: To enhance effect when treating upholstered furniture, slightly moisten the surface with a spray bottle. Moisture activates uric acid crystals, making them more accessible for oxidation by ozone.

prevention.title: Preventing recontamination
prevention.text: After ozonation, it's important to prevent reappearance of marks:
items: Eliminate the cause of marks (stress, illness, conflict with other animals)
Use pheromone diffusers to reduce anxiety
Provide sufficient number of litter boxes (rule N+1, where N is number of cats)
Clean litter boxes regularly — dirty box provokes marking
If necessary, spay/neuter the animal
For quick removal of fresh marks, use enzymatic cleaners

highlight.title: Safety:
highlight.text: Ozonation is performed with complete absence of animals! Ozone is toxic to pets just as it is to humans. Return animals to the room only after complete ventilation (1-2 hours).

car-interiors.title: Car interiors
car-interiors.content:
Car interior ozonation is a popular service at car washes and detailing centers. Over time, odors build up: tobacco, spilled drinks, food, sweat, pets. They soak into seat upholstery, carpets, headliner and AC ducts.

Ozone penetrates all interior materials, including ventilation and AC. This matters especially because bacteria and fungi often accumulate in ducts and cause odor when the AC is on.

Standard car ozonation takes 30–60 minutes. The ozone generator is placed inside, recirculation is turned on to treat the ventilation system. Ozone concentration: 20–40 mg/m³. Ventilate for 15–30 minutes after treatment.

For used cars, ozonation helps remove the "previous owner smell." For dealerships and car-sharing, regular ozonation keeps fleets fresh and hygienic.

intro.text: A car interior is an enclosed space where odors quickly accumulate: tobacco smoke, sweat, food, drinks, pets. All these odors are absorbed into the interior's textile elements: seats, carpets, headliner, as well as the ventilation and air conditioning system.
intro.text2: Dry cleaning removes dirt and stains but doesn't always handle ingrained odors. Air fresheners and deodorizers only mask the problem. Ozonation is the only method that completely destroys odor molecules, including those in AC ducts.

highlight1.title: Important:
highlight1.text: An unpleasant odor when turning on the AC is a sign that bacteria and fungi have developed in the ventilation system. Regular interior cleaning doesn't eliminate them. Ozone penetrates all ducts and eliminates the problem at the source.

problems.title: What problems ozonation solves
items: Tobacco smoke odor — ingrained in upholstery, headliner, plastic
Previous owner smell — when buying a used car
Food and drink odors — spilled coffee, fast food, spoiled products
Pet odors — fur, saliva, marks
Damp and mold odor — after flooding or long storage
Bacteria in AC — cause of unpleasant odor when turned on

steps.title: Interior preparation
steps.description: Perform standard cleaning: vacuum, wipe plastic surfaces. Remove trash and personal items. Take out floor mats for separate treatment.

steps.title: Ozone generator placement
steps.description: Place the ozone generator in the interior on the front seat or floor. Close all windows and doors. Leave a small gap for the power cord if using an external generator.

steps.title: Ventilation system treatment
steps.description: Turn on ignition, set air recirculation mode, turn fan to maximum. This ensures ozone circulation through the AC system.

steps.title: Ozonation
steps.description: Run the ozone generator for 20-40 minutes at 20-40 mg/m³ concentration. For strong odors — up to 60 minutes. Leave the car during treatment.

steps.title: Ventilation
steps.description: Open all doors and windows. Ventilate for 15-30 minutes. Turn on AC to fresh air intake mode. The car is ready for use.

service.title: Ozonation as a car wash and detailing service
service.text: For car washes and detailing centers, ozonation is a high-margin additional service. Equipment is compact, requires no consumables, pays for itself in 1-2 months with active customer promotion.

features.title: High profitability
features.description: Treatment cost is electricity. Average service price: $20-40

features.title: Quick execution
features.description: 30-60 minutes per treatment. Can be done in parallel with dry cleaning or polishing

features.title: Simple operations
features.description: Place generator, turn on, leave. Doesn't require qualified staff

features.title: Complement to dry cleaning
features.description: Ozonation after dry cleaning — comprehensive service with higher price

highlight.title: Marketing tip:
highlight.text: Offer ozonation as a mandatory part of pre-sale car preparation. Used car buyers are especially sensitive to foreign odors — this is a common reason for purchase refusal.

carsharing.title: Ozonation for car-sharing and taxis
carsharing.text: Taxi and car-sharing fleets are ideal clients for regular ozonation:
items: High turnover — many different passengers every day
Odor accumulation — food, drinks, perfume, tobacco from passengers
Sanitary requirements — especially relevant after the pandemic
Reputation risks — odor complaints lower ratings
Regularity — possibility of service contracts

highlight.title: Important:
highlight.text: After ozonating a leather interior, it's recommended to treat the leather with conditioner. Ozone can slightly dry natural leather, though at correct concentrations this is not critical.

carpet-cleaning.title: Carpets and upholstery
carpet-cleaning.content:
Carpets and upholstery are the main odor reservoirs in a room. Textile fibers absorb dust, fungal spores, bacteria, skin particles, sweat and spills. Over time a characteristic musty odor forms that normal cleaning cannot remove.

Ozonation complements conventional dry cleaning with deep deodorization and disinfection. After wet carpet cleaning, ozone penetrates fibers and destroys remaining bacteria, fungal spores and odor molecules.

For local treatment of furniture or carpet, "chamber ozonation" is used: the item is covered with plastic film and ozone is fed underneath. Exposure: 2–4 hours. This creates high ozone concentration directly in the item.

Ozonation is effective after flooding: it removes damp odor and prevents mold in wet furniture and carpets. Treatment should be done after items are dried.
